title: Judge strikes down Arkansas ban on transition care for minors
description: A federal judge struck down an Arkansas law Tuesday that would have banned transition-related medical care for transgender minors, declaring it unconstitutional.

title: Bernie Sanders announces investigation into Amazon's safety record
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., announced an investigation Tuesday into what he called Amazon's "abysmal safety record" amid broader scrutiny of the company's labor practices.

title: Legal experts say the charges against Hunter Biden are rarely brought
description: The misdemeanor tax and felony gun charges brought against President Joe Biden’s son Hunter Biden are rarely prosecuted, legal experts say.

title: Survivors say Iowa building collapse has left its close-knit community in ruins
description: The tenants of 324 Main St., in Davenport, Iowa, fled their homes "with just the clothes on our backs." Now they are trying to rebuild their lives.

title: Biden meets with AI experts in effort to manage its risks
description: President Joe Biden will meet with artificial intelligence experts in San Francisco as part of his administration's efforts to manage the risks posed by AI.

title: Screen all adults under 65 for anxiety, health panel says
description: Is there a test for anxiety? All adults under 65 should be screened regularly for anxiety and depression even if they don't have symptoms, health panel urges.

title: Man who allegedly threw phone at Bebe Rexha during concert thought 'it would be funny,' police say
description: The man who allegedly threw a phone at singer Bebe Rexha during a performance in New York City on Sunday said he did it because he thought "it would be funny," according to a criminal complaint.

title: Ex-influencers speak about their lives after leaving social media
description: A growing number of social media creators are leaving the influencer life and moving on to focus on other business ventures. NBC News' Maya Eaglin reports on how ex-influencers are rebuilding their lives after leaving social media.

title: Trump classified documents trial will begin in mid-August, judge says
description: Donald Trump's trial in the special counsel's classified documents case will begin in mid-August, Judge Aileen Cannon said in a court order unsealed Tuesday.

title: Hunter Biden to plead guilty to tax-related misdemeanor crimes
description: Hunter Biden, the president's son, is expected to plead guilty to two federal misdemeanor counts of failing to pay his taxes.

title: Go behind the scenes of robot combat leagues
description: TODAY’s Craig Melvin shares an inside look at the National Havoc Robot League and the growing sport of fighting robots.

title: Bipartisan team to limit Chinese purchase of U.S. farmland
description: Sens. Ernst and Stabenow hope to limit China’s ability to buy U.S. farmland and force the U.S. to weigh stripping some foreign landowners of their real estate.

title: Andrew Tate indicted and will face trial on rape, human trafficking charges in Romania
description: Andrew Tate will face trial on charges of rape, human trafficking and forming a criminal gang to sexually exploit women, authorities in Romania said Tuesday.

title: Senate Democrats plan abortion-rights push to mark one year without Roe v. Wade
description: Senate Democrats plan to mark the one-year anniversary of the Supreme Court’s Dobbs decision by pushing legislation centered around reproductive health and access.

title: Rescuers race against time to find missing submersible as passengers identified
description: Rescuers race against time to find missing submersible as passengers identified

title: Trump says his kids won’t serve in his administration if he wins a second term
description: Former President Donald Trump said Monday he doesn’t want his children to serve in his administration again if he wins a second term in the White House.
